Title: Minimum Wage Tracker Reference Link
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Include a direct reference link to the EPI Minimum Wage Tracker within the contract posting and review interface.
* **Goal:** Ensure all users (Primes and Subs) are educated on the local minimum wage requirements relevant to the contract location.
* **Problem Solved:** Provides a standard, external resource for local labor rates, aiding compliance and setting clear expectations during contract negotiation.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Contractor posting or reviewing a contract**,
* I want to **have quick access to a third-party minimum wage tracker link**,
* so that **I can easily verify the current local minimum and tipped wages for the contract's location.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The link to the **EPI Minimum Wage Tracker** (`https://www.epi.org/minimum-wage-tracker/#/min_wage/New%20Jersey`) must be added to the interface for **posting a contract**.
* The link must also be present in the interface for **reviewing a contract**.
* The link should be clearly labeled (e.g., "Check Local Minimum Wage").
* The link should open in a **new tab/window** so the user does not lose their place in the Route Marketplace workflow.
* The link should ideally use the contract location (City/State) to dynamically pre-filter the tracker if technically feasible (e.g., linking to the specific state).

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* Where is the **most logical placement** for this link in the Contract Posting and Contract Review workflows (e.g., near the contract location or financial details)?
* What is the **technical effort** required to dynamically update the link to pre-filter based on the contract's **State** (e.g., changing the URL fragment)?
* Does the legal team need to review the **EPI tracker** before it is formally included as a resource?

---

Title: COI Compliance and AI Text Scanning MVP
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Implement an AI-driven text scanning capability to validate key compliance details on uploaded Certificates of Insurance (COI) for the Minimum Viable Product (MVP).
* **Goal:** Use AI to verify the current status of legal documents by checking for expiration and confirming they match the associated business profile.
* **Problem Solved:** Ensures basic compliance and document validity early in the process without requiring complex third-party system integrations, streamlining the document review workflow.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Contractor** uploading my COI,
* I want the **system to automatically scan the document using AI to check for key compliance points**,
* so that **I get quick validation that my documents are not expired and correctly associated with my profile.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The system must implement a **simple AI-driven text scan** functionality upon COI upload.
* The AI scan must specifically look for and validate the **expiration date** of the document.
* The AI scan must validate that the document's essential details **match the corresponding business profile** (e.g., company name).
* The system must display a clear **pass/fail status** to the user based on the expiration and profile match validation.
* **Non-Functional Constraint:** The MVP must **avoid integrating** with external third-party compliance/vendor management platforms (e.g., VendorPM) for this functionality in the near term (targeting next year for integration).

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* What are the **specific data points** (besides expiration date and company name) that the AI scan must validate against the business profile for MVP?
* What is the defined **level of confidence/accuracy** required for the AI text scan to consider a document "validated"?
* How should the system handle a **validation failure** (e.g., block profile completion, or allow completion but flag the profile as non-compliant)?

---

Title: Contractor Network Management and Scope Expansion
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Develop features that allow Prime contractors to manage their existing network of subcontractors (beyond cleaning services) within the platform.
* **Goal:** Position the platform as a superior solution to current manual methods (Excel/Google Maps) for both **managing** and **expanding** a Prime contractor's entire subcontractor base.
* **Problem Solved:** Addresses the critical need of companies like New Image to consolidate management of their **40+ maintenance subs** and **non-cleaning subs** into one system, preventing pushback on platform adoption.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Prime Contractor** (e.g., New Image Building Services),
* I want to **manage my entire network of subcontractors, including both cleaning and non-cleaning service types (e.g., maintenance, electrical),**
* so that **I can consolidate my workflow away from manual tools (Excel/Google Maps) and use Route as my single system for subcontracting.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The platform must support the **import/manual addition** of a Prime's existing subcontractor network (e.g., New Image's 15-20 cleaning and 40+ maintenance subs).
* The platform must enable the **management** (tracking, communication, assignments) of these imported subcontractors, whether they are officially registered on the Marketplace or not.
* **Service Type Expansion Decision:** A definitive decision must be made regarding the inclusion of **non-cleaning service types** (e.g., paint, construction, electrical) on the platform.
  * If **YES**, the system must update Service Type filters to include these new categories.
  * If **NO**, a strategy must be developed to address user resistance to managing multiple systems.
* The system must demonstrate a clear advantage over basic tools like Excel and Google Maps for **tracking subcontractor activity and performance**.
* The platform must integrate tools that facilitate the current Prime workflow (handling 1-2 subcontracts monthly across multiple states).

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* **SCOPE DECISION:** Should the Marketplace **immediately allow** the inclusion and searching of non-cleaning service type contractors (e.g., maintenance, electrical, paint) to secure adoption from large accounts?
* If non-cleaning services are included, what are the **top five non-cleaning service types** that should be prioritized for data field creation?
* What is the **MVP feature** that will demonstrate superiority over a basic **Excel tracker** for managing existing subcontractor relationships?
* What is the plan to transition existing **Excel/Google Maps data** into the Route platform for companies like New Image?

---

Title: Data Sync, Search Feedback, and Geocoding Logic
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Implement a user feedback mechanism for poor search results, update the geocoding logic for missing addresses, and ensure data sync consistency between HubSpot and Marketplace.
* **Goal:** Improve the accuracy of the Marketplace data, ensure proper account filtering, and gain user-driven insight into areas requiring more contractor coverage.
* **Problem Solved:** Prevents incorrect accounts from showing on the map, provides a fallback for geocoding, and ensures all services are captured in HubSpot for accurate filtering.

---

## 3\. User Story

1. **User Story: Search Feedback**

* As a **Marketplace User**,
* I want to **click a button to alert the team when my search results are poor**,
* so that **the team can focus on adding relevant contractors to that area and improve the search quality over time.**

2. **User Story: Account Sync/Filtering**

* As a **HubSpot Admin**,
* I want to **ensure that if I change a company's "Account Type" in HubSpot, they are instantly removed from the Marketplace map if they no longer qualify**,
* so that **only eligible contractors are visible to Primes.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

### Data Sync and Filtering Logic

* **HubSpot Services Sync:** All service options currently available in the Marketplace filter tool must be added to the appropriate **HubSpot fields** to ensure accurate data capture.
* **Account Type Update:** A change to the **COMPANY ACCOUNT TYPE** in HubSpot (e.g., removal of "E-CC") must immediately trigger the removal of that company from the Marketplace map/search.

### Geocoding Fallback

* **Geocoding Priority:** If an E-CC account is missing the primary **Address 1** field (due to P.O. boxes or privacy concerns), the system must use the **City, State, Zip/Postal Code, and Country** as a **fallback** to place a PIN on the map.

### International and Location Handling

* The system must investigate the odd results when attempting to look up non-U.S. locations (e.g., Mexico ZIP codes) to ensure the ZIP and Country fields are correctly processed when international functionality is activated.

### Poor Search Results Feedback Mechanism

* A clickable **button/link** must be added to the search results page (or search interface).
* Clicking the button must trigger an **alert email** to the internal team (e.g., Product/Sales).
* The alert must capture the **user's email address** (for reply), the **search parameters** used, and the **geographic area/needs** that yielded poor results.

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* Which **specific team email address** should receive the "poor search results" alert?
* What is the **exact HubSpot field name** for "COMPANY ACCOUNT TYPE" that is used to determine map visibility, and what is the required **sync cadence** to ensure immediate removal?
* Does the fallback geocoding logic (City/State/Zip) provide an **acceptable level of accuracy** for the MVP, or should we flag these pins as having a lower confidence score?
* For the **Mexico locations**, what is the expected output/behavior when using the Marketplace ZIP lookup tool (i.e., should it simply show no results, or is the current output showing incorrect U.S. results)?

* **Goal:** Create a centralized system for tracking COI compliance, generate reminders for renewal, and use insurance data to facilitate insurance optimization partnerships.
* **Problem Solved:** Ensures compliance by automating renewal alerts and generates new revenue by identifying and acting on insurance optimization opportunities for contractors.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Contractor/Subcontractor**,
* I want to **upload my COI and have key data fields extracted and tracked with automated renewal reminders**,
* so that **I can easily stay compliant and avoid policy gaps with my Prime partners.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The system must capture all **key data fields** outlined in the attached COI document and make them **searchable** within the Marketplace.

* What are the **specific fields from the COI document** that are required for the initial MVP implementation? (Needs confirmation as the document link requires permission.)
* What is the **cost/effort estimate** for implementing **OCR/AI technology** for auto-populating COI data fields versus manual data entry for the MVP?
* What **logic or criteria** will be used to flag a contractor as potentially **"over- or under-insured"** (e.g., comparison of Annual Revenue to Liability limits)?
* Where should the **insurance carrier/expiration data** be stored to ensure easy access for our insurance partners, and what is the required **data sharing protocol**?

Title: Display Service Radius in Miles and Kilometers
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Update all service radius displays to show both miles and kilometers for clarity and international readiness.
* **Goal:** Improve user understanding of the service area measurement and prepare the platform for potential international usage.
* **Problem Solved:** Ensures users, especially those not familiar with miles, clearly understand the distance being set for their service radius.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Contractor/User**,
* I want to **see my Service Radius displayed in both Miles and Kilometers**,
* so that **I can accurately understand the geographical distance of my service area.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* All platform instances displaying the service radius distance must show the measurement in **both miles (Miles)** and **kilometers (km)**.
* The conversion ratio must be **1 Mile = 1.60934 Kilometers**.
* The display format should follow the example: **"X Miles / Y km"** (e.g., "1 Mile / 1.61 km," "50 Miles / 80.46 km").
* **Maximum Service Radius:** The default maximum radius a user can input without triggering a specific action/bottleneck is **50 Miles / 80.46 km**.
* **Radius > 50 Miles:** Any radius set **above 50 Miles / 80.46 km** must trigger a call-to-action to **Book An Appointment** using the provided link: `https://meetings.hubspot.com/cleanjack/route-onboarding-training-call`.

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* Should the call-to-action for radii over 50 miles be a **hard blocker** (preventing submission) or a **strong, persistent prompt** that allows temporary submission while flagging for follow-up?
* Should the system implement a user **preference setting** to allow users to set a **default unit (Miles or km)** for primary display, with the other unit shown secondarily?
* What are the **specific fields/screens** where the service radius input and display need to be updated (e.g., profile settings, search filters)?

Title: Opportunity Data, Import & UI Sync MVP
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Standardize key opportunity data fields, enhance the location import/add user interface, and ensure data consistency across all methods (CSV, Batch, Manual).
* **Goal:** Improve the quality of opportunity listings, streamline data input, and provide contractors with all necessary information upfront to accelerate project timelines.
* **Problem Solved:** Prevents contractors from having to ask missing questions, resolves UI inconsistencies, and formalizes core opportunity data capture.

---

## 3\. User Story

1. **User Story: Opportunity Data Capture**

* As an **Admin/Prime Contractor**,
* I want to **input all key project details (cleanable area, service frequency, scope attachments) when listing an opportunity**,
* so that **subcontractors have complete information immediately, reducing back-and-forth and speeding up the bidding process.**

2. **User Story: UI Consistency**

* As an **Admin/Prime Contractor**,
* I want the **required fields and data capture process to be identical across Manual Add, Batch ZIP, and CSV Import methods**,
* so that **I don't waste time on duplicate or inconsistent data entry and can use the tool efficiently.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

### Data Fields (Must be added to all input methods: CSV, Batch ZIP, Single Additions)

* **Opportunity Type:** Must be captured (Options: Recurring Service or One-Time Service).
* **Opportunity Status:** Must be captured (Options: Active Opportunity or Potential Opportunity).
  * Active = Prime has been awarded business.
  * Potential = Prime is working to secure business.
* **Total Cleanable Area:** (Renamed from Total Square Feet) Must be a mandatory field.
* **Service Frequency:** Must be captured.
* **Service Window (Times):** Must be captured.
* **Scope Of Work:** Must be supported as an **attachment** in a dedicated section (not in the Opportunity Description field).
* **Scope Of Work Addendum:** Must be supported as an **attachment** for location-specific additions/subtractions.
* **Tag Work Opportunities:** Must be captured (Options: Yes, No, Potential).
* **Opportunity Duration:** Must be captured (# Months or One-Time Project).
* **Service Start Date (Target):** Must be captured.

### Opportunity ID & Description

* Each Opportunity must be assigned a unique **Route #** (e.g., ROU-XXXXXXX).
* If an update is made, a **version suffix** must be added (e.g., ROU-1234.03).
* The **Opportunity Description** field must be restricted to a high-level overview of the project only.

### UI Consistency & Import Rework

* **Batch ZIP and Manual Add:** Must be 100% in sync regarding required vs. optional fields.
  * **Facility Type** and **Services** must be **required** in Batch Add to match Manual Add.
  * **Location Name** and **Cleanable Area** must be added to the Batch Add screen.
* **Batch Add Placeholder:** A placeholder for **U.S.** must be the default value.
* **CSV Import UI:**
  * **"Upload & Analyze"** and **"Import & Geocode"** button labels must be clarified or consolidated.
  * The main action button should be easily found (not at the far bottom right).
* An **Opportunity Import Template** must be provided to standardize data collection (based on the provided spreadsheet link).

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* For the new **Opportunity Status** field, which status (Active vs. Potential) should be the **default** upon creation?

Title: Email Template: Add Secondary Admin
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Implement an automated email campaign to prompt accounts with a single administrator to add a secondary admin.
* **Goal:** Increase the security and stability of client accounts by promoting the creation of backup administrator roles.
* **Problem Solved:** Reduces the risk of account access issues, delays in security response, and management bottlenecks due to having only one active administrator.

---

## 3\. User Story

* As a **Platform Administrator**,
* I want to **automatically send a reminder email to companies with only one active admin**,
* so that **they add a second administrator to improve their account security and ensure business continuity.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The system must identify all client accounts that currently have **exactly one** user with the **"Admin"** role assigned.
* The system must trigger an automated email to be sent to the primary contact or the single admin of these identified accounts.
* The email template must be based on the provided Uber for Business example, emphasizing the security and monitoring benefits of adding a second admin.
* The email must include a clear **Call-to-Action (CTA)** button labeled similar to **"Add an admin"** that links directly to the Team management or Admin invitation page.
* The email must provide contact information (e.g., support email) for users who encounter issues adding an admin.
* The email send frequency and logic must be defined to prevent spamming single-admin accounts (e.g., send once every 30 days until a second admin is added).

* What is the **exact URL or page path** that the "Add an admin" CTA button should link to?

* **Feature:** Create a tool to easily copy a master company profile to multiple branch profiles within the same corporate account.

1. **User Story: Profile Duplication for Large Accounts**

Title: Contractor Vetting Data Fields and Vetting Questions
Description:
## 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* **Feature:** Define and implement new data fields and vetting questions based on KleenMark's requirements for contractor assessment.
* **Goal:** Improve the quality and depth of contractor profile data for clients like KleenMark to use in vetting and selection.
* **Problem Solved:** Ensures key data points regarding **retention, safety (EMR), ownership, and quality programs** are captured.

---

## 3\. User Story

1. **User Story: Contractor Profile Enhancement**

* As a **Contractor**,
* I want to **provide detailed information about my client retention, employee turnover, and safety record**,
* so that **clients can easily vet my company using their key performance indicators.**

2. **User Story: Ownership Filter**

* As a **Vetting Client** (e.g., KleenMark),
* I want to **filter contractors based on their detailed company ownership structure**,
* so that **I can find partners who meet my specific private/public equity criteria.**

---

## 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The system must include a question to capture **Client Retention Rate** with the following time frames (or similar) requested: 1 Year, 2 Year, 3 Year.
* The system must include a question to capture **Employee Retention/Turnover Rate** with a target benchmark of **less than 75% annually** (or a similar annual timeframe).
* The system must include a question to capture **Company Ownership Structure** with the following options:
  * Private (100% privately owned)
  * Public (100% publicly traded)
  * Mixed – Combination of private and public ownership
* If "Mixed" ownership is selected, the system must prompt the user to input the approximate **percentage privately held**.
* The system must capture the **Safety Mod Rate (EMR)**, which is expected to be uploaded with the Certificate of Insurance (COI).
  * **EMR Score** must be less than 1 to be considered desirable.
* The system must include a question to confirm if the contractor has/utilizes a **Quality Assurance Program**.
  * This should be a **Yes/No** question.
  * If "Yes," a follow-up question must ask what tools they use, offering a **drop-down menu** with known SaaS options and a **Manual Forms** option.
* **Service Verticals** must be defined as **Commercial only** (Residential should not be a required filter).
* The system must allow for filtering contractors by **desired annual revenue of $2 million - $20 million**.

---

## 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* How will the system **validate** the **Client Retention** and **Employee Retention/Turnover** rates provided by contractors, since this is flagged as a "trust factor" and hard to validate?
* What is the **specific data type/field format** for capturing the **Client Retention** and **Employee Retention/Turnover** percentages?
* What is the **exact list of known SaaS options** for the "What tools do they use?" Quality Assurance Program question?
* Does the **EMR Score** need to be stored as a separate field, even if uploaded via the COI document, to enable filtering?

Title: Show Registration and Profile Progress
Description:
# 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* Add a visual status to easily filter and see if E-CC accounts are **registered** or **unregistered**.
* Display the **percentage of profile completion** on public account cards to encourage finishing profiles.
* Use both statuses in Marketplace and HubSpot to target users with correct messaging and opportunities.

# 3\. User Story

There are two distinct user stories:

1. Story Title: Track Account Registration Status
   * As a marketing or sales user,
   * I want to easily see and filter if an E-CC account is registered or unregistered in Marketplace and HubSpot,
   * so that I can send the right marketing messages to encourage conversion and target registered users with opportunities.
2. Story Title: Encourage Profile Completion
   * As a contractor account owner,
   * I want the Marketplace to show my profile completion status to others,
   * so that I feel indirect pressure to finish my profile and receive stronger, more accurate job recommendations.

# 4\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

### **A. Registered vs. Unregistered Status**

* All E-CC accounts in Marketplace must display a clear **visual indicator** (e.g., color or icon) showing if the account is **Registered** or **Unregistered**.
* The **Registered Status** must be a filterable field in the Marketplace search results.
* The **Registered Status** must be a filterable field within HubSpot for segmentation.

### **B. Profile Completion Status**

* Each account's profile card in the Marketplace must publicly display a **Profile Completion Percentage**.
* The visual display for completion should use a **circular progress ring** (e.g., Apple Watch style).
* The progress ring must reflect the percentage accurately: 25% filled for a quarter-complete profile, 100% filled for a fully complete profile.
* The completion percentage is key to generating **stronger, dialed-in recommendations** for Prime contractors.

---

# 5\. Open Questions for the Product Team

* What are the specific fields that define **100% profile completion** (e.g., required registration fields plus supplementary data)?
* What is the threshold or logic for making contract/opportunity details "more available" to accounts with higher completion percentages?
* What exact color shading or icon will be used to distinguish between Registered and Unregistered accounts?

Title: Define Workforce, Employees, and Contractors
Description:
# 2\. Feature Request Idea Summary

* As a product manager,
* I want to formalize the definitions for W-2 Employees, 1099 Independent Contractors, and Total Workforce,

Title: Add "Maybe" Option for Subcontract Status
Description:
## 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* The feature requests adding a third option, **"Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"**, to the existing "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field for contractors. 
* The goal is to avoid closing the door completely on contractors who are hesitant to engage in subcontracting due to past negative experiences. 
* This "Maybe" status allows them to receive opportunity alerts, providing market insight and business intelligence, and encourages them to consider opportunities on a case-by-case basis. The intent is to nurture contractors and keep them engaged with the platform.

### 2\. User Story

* As a **Sales/Onboarding Team Member**, 
* I want to **set a contractor's subcontracting preference to "Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"** 
* so that **I can nurture hesitant contractors by keeping them engaged with relevant opportunity alerts and eventually convert them to "Yes."**

### 3\. Acceptance Criteria (AC)

* The "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field on the contractor profile/settings must include the following three selectable options for the user:
  * **Yes**
  * **No**
  * **Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)**
* The selected option must be successfully saved to the backend system upon form submission.
* The backend alert system must include all companies where the "Open To Subcontract Opportunities" field is set to **"Yes"** OR **"Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)"** in the distribution list for subcontract opportunity alerts.
* Companies selecting **"No"** must be excluded from receiving these opportunity alerts.

---

## Open Questions for the Product Team

* **Data Field Name/Value:** What is the precise backend field name and the associated value for the "Maybe (Open To Review Opportunities)" option? (e.g., `is_open_to_subcontract: 'maybe'`).
* **System of Record:** Is this preference field being implemented in the new "Exchange" platform, or is this an update to an existing system like HubSpot?
* **"Maybe" Field Value Persistence:** Does the "Maybe" preference persist indefinitely, or is there an intention to set an expiration date or require re-confirmation after a certain period (e.g., 6 months) to ensure the preference is still accurate?
* **Alert Customization:** For the MVP, should the content, format, or frequency of the alerts be identical for both "Yes" and "Maybe" users?

Title: Ratings and Reviews
Description:
# 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* Allow **internal users** (PRIME/SUBCONTRACTOR) to request and submit structured feedback/ratings on their collaborative work, possibly tied to a Quarterly Business Review (QBR) cycle.
* The feedback mechanism must use a **1-5 star rating** system with half-star increments and include a mandatory text **feedback field** for each question.
* All ratings and reviews must be viewable in a **detailed summary** that includes aggregation, filtering (e.g., date range, score), and **transparent counter-responses** while keeping the identities of the PRIME/SUBCONTRACTOR who rated them visible *only* to each other.

---

## User Story

* As a **PRIME or SUBCONTRACTOR user**,
* I want to **initiate, submit, and view structured, aggregated, and filterable ratings and reviews** for partnership opportunities with appropriate transparency and access controls,
* so that **performance is officially tracked, analyzed over time, and openly discussed** between the involved parties without public exposure of the partnership details.

## **Acceptance Criteria (AC)**

* The system must allow a user to initiate a rating/review for an active opportunity after a defined period (e.g., related to a QBR cycle).
* The rating form must require a **1-5 star rating** with **half-star increments** (1.0, 1.5, 2.0, etc.) and a **mandatory feedback field** for each question.
* The system must automatically calculate and display an **overall star rating** upon completion of the review.
* A dedicated dashboard must display submitted ratings and reviews individually and as an **aggregated summary**.
* The summary must include filtering options by **date range** (e.g., Past 6 Months, Past Year), **score** (e.g., highest to lowest), and **chronology** (e.g., newest to oldest).
* Users must be able to **submit a counter-response** to any submitted review.
* All submitted feedback and counter-responses must be visible and transparent to platform users.
* **Access Control:** The identity of the **PRIME and SUBCONTRACTOR** involved in a specific review must **only be visible to those two involved parties**; all other users must see an anonymized view.

Title: 1099 vs W2 Calculations Adjustments
Description:
## 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* The existing **"W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation"** needs to be updated to capture a more accurate and flexible view of a company's subcontracting utilization.
* The current **"Company Size (W-2 Employees)"** field should be made clearer by updating its header.
* The vague **"1099 Subcontracted %"** field should be replaced with **two specific, quantitative metrics** that allow Prime Contractors to better filter, assess, and engage with potential subcontractors.

## User Story

As a **Subcontractor**, 

I want to **input specific, standardized metrics** regarding my company's **W-2 employee size and 1099 subcontracting utilization**, 

so that **Prime Contractors can accurately filter and assess my company's capabilities** based on their self-performing vs. subcontracting requirements.

## Acceptance Criteria

* The header/label for the existing field tracking W-2 employee count is updated to **"Company Size (W-2 Employees)"**.
* The following new data fields are added to the company profile data capture section (replacing the current "1099 Subcontracted %" field):
  * **Number of Subcontractor (1099) Companies** (Input field for an integer/whole number).
  * **Percentage Of Work Subcontracted** (Input field for a percentage, allowing one decimal place, e.g., XX.X).
* Both new fields are **mandatory** to ensure Prime Contractors have the baseline information required for filtering.
* The system must store the data for the new fields and display them on the contractor's profile viewable by Prime Contractors.

---

[Slack](https://routeplatform.slack.com/archives/C098HEHN2HL/p1763990268639859)

> Based on feedback from Frank W. at The Facilities Group (they work with over 3,000 ISP - Independent Service Providers) as it pertains to the W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation Discussion, they calculate from two angles - Revenue % and % Of Contract.  Revenue % is an easy to understand calculation, although while % Of Contract is easy to calculate at the Opportunity Level (can go % labor hours, % revenue, % people), when you start to roll all Opportunities and Contracts into a Company Level snapshot, the number becomes a little more gray and "what it you want it to be for the client calculation".
> Based on this feedback and other feedback collected, proposing we update the W-2 vs 1099 Data Capture/Calculation as follows:
>
> * a) For the **Company Size (W-2 Employees)** data point < suggest we update header as shown to left so clear and we still utilize and capture the current drop down range
> * b) For the **1099 Subcontracted %** < Since the feedback we are receiving is every company calculates this percentage differently, e.g. employee (individual) vs subcontractor (individual), revenue W-2 vs 1099, account count W-2 vs 1099, I suggest we capture this data with two data fields/numbers that will give the Prime's enough baseline info and insights to understand the level of subcontracting occurring with a given contractor.  Based on these two fields/numbers, the PRIME will be able to 1) filter in/out what they are looking for and 2) when a match is made determine if additional conversation is needed around a given opportunity, e.g. we want you to self performing this opportunity at minimum this percentage.  The two data fields/numbers are:
>
> > **Subcontractor Utilization Overview (Company Wide):**
>
> * **Number of Subcontractor (1099) Companies      xx**
> * **Percentage Of Work Subcontracted                     xx.x**

Title: Exchange Network Dashboard for Prime Contractors
Description:
## 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* The core request is to **design and build a comprehensive "Exchange Network Dashboard"** for Prime Contractors to manage and filter a large number of Subcontractor profiles.
* The dashboard requires a **specific set of data fields** to be displayed for each contractor, including company metrics, service capabilities, and utilization data (W-2/1099).
* The dashboard must include robust **filtering capabilities** based on these key data fields to support granular search and selection.

## User Story

As a **Prime Contractor**, I want a **searchable and filterable Exchange Network Dashboard** that displays **all critical subcontractor data fields in a customizable grid view**, so that I can **efficiently assess and select the most qualified subcontractors** from a large pool based on multiple criteria and perspectives.

## Acceptance Criteria

* **Dashboard Structure:** The dashboard presents Subcontractor data in a **tabular/grid layout** where each row is a company and each column is a data field (matching the spreadsheet structure).
* **Data Fields Displayed:** The dashboard must display (as columns) the key data fields outlined in the provided spreadsheet (e.g., Company Name, Location, **Company Size (W-2 Employees)**, **Subcontractor (1099) Companies**, **Percentage Of Work Subcontracted**, Insurance Liability Limit, Services Provided, etc.).
* **Filtering Capability:** The user must be able to **filter the list** based on all critical data fields, including, but not limited to:
  * **Location** (City/State/ZIP Code/Radius)
  * **Service Type** (Multi-select)
  * **Insurance Liability Limit** (Range filter: e.g., $\\ge \\$2M$)
  * **W-2 / 1099 Data** (Range filters on W-2 Employee Size and Percentage Of Work Subcontracted)
* **Sorting and Customization:** The Prime Contractor must be able to **sort the dashboard results** by any column header (e.g., by Location, W-2 Size, etc.) and **customize which columns are visible**.
* **Actionable Items:** Each Subcontractor row must include an **actionable link/button** to view the full profile and/or initiate contact/bidding.

Title: Credential Management and Branding
Description:
## 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* The "Credentials" page needs a **user-friendly sharing and downloading mechanism** for the uploaded documents.
* The terminology used for document status and verification needs to be **de-risked** by avoiding strong terms like "VERIFIED" and "Validated," opting instead for low-liability terms like **"Exchange Received"** or **"Contractor-Provided"**.
* The **page header, labels, and instructional text** for all document uploads need to be **polished for consistency, clarity, and branding**.
* A **new call-to-action (CTA)** is required under the Insurance section to promote a complimentary review through a specific partnership.

### User Story

As a **Company Member**, I want the **"Credentials" page** to feature **low-liability, business-focused terminology** and provide **quick action links** to view, share, and download my company's uploaded documents, so that I can **efficiently manage our compliance materials** and **leverage the platform's trusted partnerships**.

## Acceptance Criteria

* **Header Updated:** The page header is updated to:

  > **Credentials** Demonstrate you are **Business Ready** by uploading the applicable documents below—building trust, strengthening credibility, and positioning your company for new opportunities.
* **Document Actions:** For each uploaded document, there are distinct, functional buttons/links for **VIEW**, **SHARE (via email link)**, and **DOWNLOAD**.
* **Verification Terminology:** All instances of strong verification terms (like "VERIFIED" or "Validated") are replaced with a low-liability term like **"Contractor-Provided"** or **"Exchange Received"** (specifically for the progress summary status).
* **Instructional Text Updates:**
  * **Business License:**
    * Label updated to: **"Upload your current business license."**
    * New Note added: **"If your company operates across multiple markets or states, please upload the active business license for the city/state where your corporate office is registered."**
  * **COI (Insurance):** Instructions updated to: **"Upload your current Certificate of Insurance."**
  * **W-9:** Instructions updated to: **"Upload your current W-9."** (Replacing "Required for 1099 reporting and payment processing.")
* **Insurance CTA:** A new section/block is added under the Insurance (COI) document upload with the following text and CTA link:

  > Interested in a complimentary review of your company’s insurance? Ensure you’re properly protected, identify any potential liability gaps, and confirm you’re only paying for the coverage you truly need. **Request Your Complimentary Insurance Review**

Title: Add a ICON/Tool that allows for quick OPEN 24 Hours Day
Description:
## 💡 Feature Request Idea Summary

* The user needs a dedicated **tool or icon** to facilitate the creation of an opportunity that is **open for bidding for 24 hours**.
* This tool should be easily accessible, suggesting a **quick-action button** or similar UI element.
* The goal is to streamline the process for rapidly soliciting bids for time-sensitive needs.

## User Story

As an **Opportunity Creator (Prime Contractor)**, I want a **dedicated "Quick 24-Hour" button** on the opportunity creation screen, so that I can **instantly set the bidding window to close after exactly 24 hours** without manually adjusting the time/date.

## Acceptance Criteria

* A new, clearly labeled **ICON/Tool/Button** (e.g., "24-Hour Quick Bid" or clock icon) is added to the Opportunity Creation flow.
* When the user clicks this button, the system **automatically populates the bidding end date/time** to be exactly **24 hours from the current time** (or the time the opportunity is published/made live).
* Clicking the quick-action button must **overwrite any manually entered closing date/time**.
* The user must still have the **ability to manually adjust** the closing date/time after clicking the 24-hour button.
